body: // Made with help from xyantoaster_'s MvM Popfile Snippets
StartingCurrency                      ${1:400} // Starting money for the mission
RespawnWaveTime                       ${2:7} // How long Red's respawn waves take (seconds)
CanBotsAttackWhileInSpawnRoom         ${4:No} // Can the bots attack before they have dropped into the map?
// Both of these SentryBuster keys only work if there is a Sentry Buster Mission in the popfile.
AddSentryBusterWhenKillCountExceeds   ${5:15} // Will automatically spawn a Sentry Buster when Red's Engineer(s) get more than X kills.
AddSentryBusterWhenDamageDealtExceeds ${6:3000} // Will automatically spawn a Sentry Buster when the Red's Engineer(s) gets more than X total damage.
Advanced                              ${7:0} // Only enable for Advanced/Expert missions (for achievements)
EventPopFile                          ${8:Halloween} // If you don't want this mission to be like wave 666 then delete this line
IsEndless                             ${9:0} // Makes the waves spawn in continuously with no time between waves. Might be broken.
Wave Schedule No WaveSpawns.description: Print a WaveSchedule Template with (mostly) everything you need to begin making a mission, but no WaveSpawns

body: // Made with help from xyantoaster_'s MvM Popfile Snippets
StartingCurrency                      ${1:400} // Starting money for the mission
RespawnWaveTime                       ${2:7} // How long Red's respawn waves take (seconds)
CanBotsAttackWhileInSpawnRoom         ${4:No} // Can the bots attack before they have dropped into the map?
// Both of these SentryBuster keys only work if there is a Sentry Buster Mission in the popfile.
AddSentryBusterWhenKillCountExceeds   ${5:15} // Will automatically spawn a Sentry Buster when Red's Engineer(s) get more than X kills.
AddSentryBusterWhenDamageDealtExceeds ${6:3000} // Will automatically spawn a Sentry Buster when the Red's Engineer(s) gets more than X total damage.
Advanced                              ${7:0} // Only enable for Advanced/Expert missions (for achievements)
EventPopFile                          ${8:Halloween} // If you don't want this mission to be like wave 666 then delete this line
IsEndless                             ${9:0} // Makes the waves spawn in continuously with no time between waves. Might be broken.
Target wave_start_relay // Replace with "Target wave_start_relay_classic" for Rottenburg
Name "${13:wave1a}" // The name of this WaveSpawn
Where ${14:spawnbot} //Where the bots will spawn. Usually this will be spawnbot
TotalCount ${15:12} // How many bots will spawn in TOTAL
MaxActive ${16:6} // How many bots from this WaveSpawn can be spawned at once.
SpawnCount ${17:3} // The amount to spawn each time the game spawns in the bots.
WaitBeforeStarting ${18:0} // The amount of time to wait before spawning in these bots.
WaitBetweenSpawns ${19:10} // The amount of time in between spawning the bots.
TotalCurrency ${20:60} // The TOTAL amount of money the bots from this WaveSpawn will drop.
Wave Schedule with One Wave.description: Print a WaveSchedule Template with (mostly) everything you need to begin making a 1 wave mission

body: // Made with help from xyantoaster_'s MvM Popfile Snippets
StartingCurrency                      ${1:400} // Starting money for the mission
RespawnWaveTime                       ${2:7} // How long Red's respawn waves take (seconds)

// Both of these SentryBuster keys only work if there is a Sentry Buster Mission in the popfile.

Advanced                              ${7:0} // Only enable for Advanced/Expert missions (for achievements)
EventPopFile                          ${8:Halloween} // If you don't want this mission to be like wave 666 then delete this line
IsEndless                             ${9:0} // Makes the waves spawn in continuously with no time between waves. Might be broken.

MaxActive ${16:6} // How many bots from this WaveSpawn can be spawned at once.
SpawnCount ${17:3} // The amount to spawn each time the game spawns in the bots.
WaitBeforeStarting ${18:0} // The amount of time to wait before spawning in these bots.
WaitBetweenSpawns ${19:10} // The amount of time in between spawning the bots.
TotalCurrency ${20:60} // The TOTAL amount of money the bots from this WaveSpawn will drop.

Keyvalues Only Wave Schedule.description: Print a WaveSchedule Template with only the base keyvalues

Bases.description: Include the basic base files for robot templates

Sniper Mission.description: Prints a Sniper support bot Mission template

Spy Mission.description: Prints a Spy support bot Mission template

Sentry Buster Mission.description: Prints a Sentry Buster support bot Mission template

body: // Wave ${1:X} Teleporter Engis (Teleports into map (does not spawn at spawnbot) and tries to build sentry and tele)
// Wave ${1:X} Battle Teleporter Engis (Does not teleport into map (spawns at spawnbot) and tries to build sentry and tele)
Battle Engineer Mission.description: Prints a Battle Engineer Mission template

body: // Wave ${1:X} Sentry Engis (Teleport into map (does not spawn at spawnbot) and tries to build sentry, but will not build tele)
Sentry Only Engineer Mission.description: Prints a Sentry Only Engineer Mission template

body: // Wave ${1:X} Sentry Battle Engis (Does not teleport into map (spawns at spawnbot) and tries to build sentry, but will not build tele)
Sentry Only Battle Engineer Mission.description: Prints a Sentry Only Battle Engineer Mission template

body: WaitForAllDead "${7:waveXXy}" // You can only have either WFASpawned or WFADead
Support ${11:Limited} // This will make the robots appear in Support. 1 makes them spawn infinitely and Limited makes only TotalCount spawn. Delete this line to make them normal bots
Basic WaveSpawn template.description: Prints a basic wavespawn template for one-robot type subwaves

body: // You can only have either WaitBetweenSpawns or WaitBetweenSpawnsAfterDeath so delete one
Support ${12:Limited} // This will make the robots appear in Support. 1 makes them spawn infinitely and Limited makes only TotalCount spawn. Delete this line to make them normal bots
ClassIcon          ${15:scout} // Check https://testing.potato.tf/icons.html for a big list of icons (most are not vanilla).
Health             ${16:125} // Delete to have default HP
WeaponRestrictions ${17:PrimaryOnly} // Delete to let it use all weapons. Primary(Only), Seconday, or Melee
Attributes         ${18:(Attribute)} // Check https://gist.github.com/sigsegv-mvm/9ce39744fde2aa4c6156 (lines 174-201) for a list of all attributes
Scout WaveSpawn template.description: Prints a full wavespawn template for a Scout subwave

body: // You can only have either WaitBetweenSpawns or WaitBetweenSpawnsAfterDeath so delete one
Support ${12:Limited} // This will make the robots appear in Support. 1 makes them spawn infinitely and Limited makes only TotalCount spawn. Delete this line to make them normal bots
ClassIcon          ${15:soldier} // Check https://testing.potato.tf/icons.html for a big list of icons (most are not vanilla).
Health             ${16:200} // Delete to have default HP
WeaponRestrictions ${17:PrimaryOnly} // Delete to let it use all weapons. Primary(Only), Seconday, or Melee
Attributes         ${18:(Attribute)} // Check https://gist.github.com/sigsegv-mvm/9ce39744fde2aa4c6156 (lines 174-201) for a list of all attributes
Soldier WaveSpawn template.description: Prints a full wavespawn template for a Soldier subwave

body: Support ${11:Limited} // This will make the robots appear in Support. 1 makes them spawn infinitely and Limited makes only TotalCount spawn. Delete this line to make them normal bots
ShouldPreserveSquad ${13:1} // If the squad leader dies, should the rest stay as a squad?
Squad WaveSpawn template.description: Prints a basic wavespawn template with Squad TFBots.

body: Support ${11:Limited} // This will make the robots appear in Support. 1 makes them spawn infinitely and Limited makes only TotalCount spawn. Delete this line to make them normal bots
RandomChoice WaveSpawn Template.description: Prints a basic wavespawn template with random-choice TFBots.

body: WaitBetweenSpawns ${6:15} // Only keep this if there will be more than one tank in this wavespawn
Name "tankboss" // It's not recommended to change this name, as it will break most maps.
Tank WaveSpawn template.description: Prints a basic wavespawn template for a tank.

InitWaveOutput.description: Prints the InitWaveOutput section if your map needs it.
